author: The B1M
description:
Why the UK's worst building disaster should never have happened.
Support the Grenfell Foundation 👉 https://www.grenfellfoundation.org.uk/fundraising

Full story here - https://theb1m.com/video/grenfell-tower-fire-london

Additional footage and images courtesy of Grenfell Tower Inquiry, ABC News, BBC News / Newsnight, Bloomberg, CBC News, ChiralJon / CC BY 2.0, David Pickup, Declan Conor, 5 News, ITV News, Natalie Oxford / CC BY 4.0, NBC News, Nick Hawkes, On Demand News, Reuters, Sky News, Tamas Babai and The Independent.

00:00 The Night of the Fire
03:47 The Tower Today
05:33 A Survivor's Account
07:48 The Causes
08:48 Cost-cutting
10:14 Combustible Cladding
11:51 Stay-Put Policy 
13:30 The Report
15:49 Government Failings
17:17 What's Changed?
21:03 Leaseholders' Struggles
24:45 The Remediation Plan
26:17 The Wait for Justice
29:29 The Tower's Future
31:02 Conclusion

Research Sources
https://www.grenfelltowerinquiry.org.uk/phase-2-report 
https://assets.grenfelltowerinquiry.org.uk
title: The Grenfell Tower Fire: London’s High-Rise Scandal

author: The B1M
description:
June 14 marks eight years since London's Grenfell Tower fire in which 72 people lost their lives. Today, 2,919 nights on, thousands are still going to bed in dangerous buildings, unable to get them remediated because of disputes between landlords, freeholders and building owners over who should foot the bill. 

In one of the hardest videos we have ever produced, we've looked back at the Grenfell Tower tragedy, exploring what happened on that dreadful night, what has happened since, who - if anyone - has been held to account, and the impact the disaster has had on the UK as it continues to grapple with a widespread cladding crisis. The result is a difficult watch, but one that we should all take the time to digest to ensure something like this can never happen again. 

The video is now available to watch on @TheB1M channel.
title: High-Rise SCANDAL: London’s Grenfell Tower Fire
